businessSummary.oneLiner: Government and enterprise AI data analytics platform ‚Äî transforming from core US defense/intelligence partner into commercial AI powerhouse
businessSummary.description: Palantir builds software platforms that analyze and integrate complex data. Since launching AIP (AI Platform), its commercial segment has grown explosively. Q4 2025 revenue reached $1.407B (+70% YoY), with US commercial revenue at $507M (+137% YoY). 2026 revenue guidance implies +61% growth, entering a $10B trajectory. Recent highlights include a DHS $1B 5-year BPA, expanded Rackspace AI infrastructure partnership, and multiple analyst target upgrades. Shares closed at $135.94 on 2/26, up +1.30%. Currently 34% below the 52-week high of $207.
howTheyMakeMoney: US Government: DoD, CIA, NSA, DHS data analytics platforms ‚Äî Q4 $570M (+66% YoY)
US Commercial: Enterprise AI/data analytics ‚Äî Q4 $507M (+137% YoY), fastest-growing segment
International Government: NATO allies and other foreign government contracts
International Commercial: Global enterprise clients (Airbus Skywise, etc.)
Subscription SaaS model: Annual contracts, top 20 customers avg $94M/yr (+45% YoY)
keyProducts: AIP (Artificial Intelligence Platform) ‚Äî enterprise AI integration, core growth engine
Gotham ‚Äî government/defense data analysis and decision-making platform
Foundry ‚Äî enterprise data integration and operations platform
Apollo ‚Äî software deployment automation and management
TITAN ‚Äî US Army next-gen intelligence system

keyMetrics.name: P/E (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Elevated based on $0.63 EPS. Reflects high-growth premium

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Based on FY2026 EPS $1.32 estimate. Still premium but justified by growth

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: High among SaaS companies. Scale economies kicking in

keyMetrics.name: PEG
keyMetrics.interpretation: Premium valuation vs. growth, but AI leader premium warranted

growthDrivers.title: DHS $1B 5-year BPA ‚Äî procurement without competitive bidding
growthDrivers.description: Signed with DHS on 2/19. Allows CBP, ICE, Secret Service, FEMA, TSA, CISA to procure Palantir software without competitive bidding.

growthDrivers.title: Rackspace partnership ‚Äî 30‚Üí250+ dedicated engineers
growthDrivers.description: Strategic AI deployment partnership announced 2/18. Foundry and AIP on Rackspace Private Cloud and UK Sovereign datacenters. Engineers scaling from 30 to 250+ within 12 months.

growthDrivers.title: US commercial revenue +137% ‚Äî AIP-driven explosive growth
growthDrivers.description: Q4 US commercial revenue $507M (+137% YoY). Top 20 customers avg $94M/yr (+45%). Deal value backlog $4.38B (+145%).

growthDrivers.title: Analyst target upgrade wave
growthDrivers.description: Mizuho upgraded Hold‚ÜíBuy at $195 (2/18). Citi maintains Strong Buy at $260. TipRanks avg $191. Consensus Buy (20 analysts).

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Undisputed #1 in government/defense AI, rapidly building commercial AI position via AIP. Irreplaceable in data security + AI integration.

moats.description: Highest-level clearances with CIA, NSA, DHS. DHS BPA enables procurement without competitive bidding.
More customers ‚Üí better AI models ‚Üí more customer attraction. Virtuous cycle.
Deeply integrated into customer data infrastructure. DHS 5-year BPA proves stickiness.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.detail: Expanding AI features in data cloud but weak in government sector.

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.detail: Private, data lakehouse. Competing in enterprise AI.

competitors.name: C3.ai
competitors.detail: Enterprise AI platform. Significantly behind in growth and scale.

competitors.name: Percepta AI
competitors.detail: Founded by ex-Palantir core employees. Non-compete injunction denied.

recentNews.headline: DHS awards $1B 5-year BPA ‚Äî no competitive bidding required
recentNews.significance: Covers all DHS sub-agencies. RPO surged from $2.6B to $4.2B.

recentNews.headline: DHS $1B + insider selling disclosed simultaneously
recentNews.significance: Mixed signals with large contract and insider sales disclosed together.

recentNews.headline: Rackspace AI partnership ‚Äî 250+ dedicated engineers
recentNews.significance: Includes UK Sovereign datacenter. Accelerating global AIP deployment.

recentNews.headline: Q4 2025: Revenue $1.407B (+70%), US commercial +137%
recentNews.significance: Earnings beat. 2026 guidance +61% growth toward $10B trajectory.

recentNews.headline: Motley Fool: 'Palantir landed its next $1 billion deal'
recentNews.significance: Analysis of DHS BPA's strategic significance in cementing government AI dominance.

analystOpinions.notableComment: Buy consensus among 20 analysts. Citi $260 Strong Buy, Mizuho $195 (upgraded Hold‚ÜíBuy). TipRanks Moderate Buy at $191. Valuation becoming more attractive after 34% correction from 52-week high.

risks.title: P/E 216x ‚Äî sustainability of AI premium in question
risks.description: Forward P/E 103x. Despite high growth, valuation burden remains significant. Sharp multiple contraction risk if growth slows.

risks.title: Persistent insider selling
risks.description: Insider sales disclosed alongside DHS contract. SBC-driven dilution at +4.67% YoY.

risks.title: Government budget cut risk
risks.description: DOGE (Department of Government Efficiency) and budget reduction movements could impact government contracts.

risks.title: Intensifying competition ‚Äî Percepta AI and others
risks.description: Percepta AI, founded by ex-Palantir key employees, entering the market after non-compete injunction was denied.

risks.title: Political risk ‚Äî immigration/surveillance controversy
risks.description: ICE contract-related ESG and reputational risks. Some institutional investors may avoid.

buyReasons.title: DHS $1B BPA ‚Äî cementing government AI monopoly
buyReasons.rationale: Procurement without competitive bidding across all DHS agencies. RPO $4.2B. Maximum long-term revenue visibility.

buyReasons.title: US commercial +137% ‚Äî AIP as growth engine
buyReasons.rationale: Deal value backlog $4.38B (+145%). Top customer ARPU $94M. Enterprise AI demand exploding.

buyReasons.title: 34% correction from 52-week high ‚Äî entry opportunity
buyReasons.rationale: Down from $207 to $136. Improving fundamentals (+70% growth) vs. price decline suggests entry point.

buyReasons.title: Net cash $6.95B ‚Äî financial strength
buyReasons.rationale: Debt/equity 0.03. Ample capacity for M&A and R&D. Resilient through economic downturns.

overallOpinion: Palantir is cementing its dominance in AI data analytics with Q4 revenue +70%, US commercial +137%, and a $1B DHS BPA that allows procurement without competitive bidding.

At $136, 34% below the $207 52-week high, the current correction may offer an attractive entry point given the growth momentum. However, P/E 216x and Forward P/E 103x still price in flawless execution.
Key variables are AIP commercial growth sustainability and the government budget environment. The consensus target of $188 (+38%) suggests upside, but valuation compression risk remains.

sources.name: The Guardian
sources.description: Q4 earnings and government contract analysis
